newsitem.title: USA: Citation Computer sees lower Q1 results.
newsitem.headline: Citation Computer sees lower Q1 results.

text.p: Citation Computer Systems Inc said it expects to report a fiscal 1998 first quarter loss of $0.03 to $0.05 a share on revenues of about $4.3 million.

In its year ago first quarter ended June 30, 1996, Citation Computer reported a profit equal to $0.16 a share on revenues of $6.7 million. The company which provides information systems for healthcare facilities.

Citation Computer attributed the shortfall in first quarter revenues to fewer system sales and lower service revenue. Several orders did not close during the quarter as expected, the company said in a news release.

In addition, last year's revenue included $400,000 from the company's United Kingdom operation which was sold in February 1997 and $600,000 from its Singapore partner. There were no such sales this year.

The company said it is optimistic about the outlook. "Itr will take nother quarter or so for the impact of Ciutation;s new products and programs to be reflected in our operating performance," said J. Robert Cooper, chairman and chief executive officer, in a statement.
Shares of Citation Computer closed at 7-7/16 yesterday.
